parameters.name: logdir
parameters.documentation: Log directory in which the summary data will be written.

parameters.name: maxQueue
parameters.documentation: Maximum queue length (default: `10`).

parameters.name: flushMillis
parameters.documentation:
Flush every __ milliseconds (default: `120e3`, i.e,
`120` seconds).

parameters.name: filenameSuffix
parameters.documentation:
Suffix of the protocol buffer file names to be
written in the `logdir` (default: `.v2`).

parameters.name: logdir
parameters.documentation: Directory to which the logs will be written.

parameters.name: args
parameters.documentation: Optional configuration arguments.

parameters.name: updateFreq
parameters.documentation:
The frequency at which loss and metric values are written to logs.

Currently supported options are:

- 'batch': Write logs at the end of every batch of training, in addition
   to the end of every epoch of training.
- 'epoch': Write logs at the end of every epoch of training.

Note that writing logs too often slows down the training.

Default: 'epoch'.

parameters.name: contents
parameters.documentation: The BMP-encoded image in an Uint8Array.

parameters.name: channels
parameters.documentation:
An optional int. Defaults to 0. Accepted values are
0: use the number of channels in the BMP-encoded image.
3: output an RGB image.
4: output an RGBA image.

symbols.documentation:
Decode the first frame of a BMP-encoded image to a 3D Tensor of dtype
`int32`.

parameters.name: contents
parameters.documentation: The GIF-encoded image in an Uint8Array.

symbols.documentation: Decode the frame(s) of a GIF-encoded image to a 4D Tensor of dtype `int32`.

parameters.name: content
parameters.documentation: The encoded image in an Uint8Array.

parameters.name: channels
parameters.documentation:
An optional int. Defaults to 0, use the number of channels in
the image. Number of color channels for the decoded image. It is used
when image is type Png, Bmp, or Jpeg.

parameters.name: dtype
parameters.documentation:
The data type of the result. Only `int32` is supported at this
time.

parameters.name: expandAnimations
parameters.documentation:
A boolean which controls the shape of the returned
op's output. If True, the returned op will produce a 3-D tensor for PNG,
JPEG, and BMP files; and a 4-D tensor for all GIFs, whether animated or
not. If, False, the returned op will produce a 3-D tensor for all file
types and will truncate animated GIFs to the first frame.

symbols.documentation:
Given the encoded bytes of an image, it returns a 3D or 4D tensor of the
decoded image. Supports BMP, GIF, JPEG and PNG formats.

symbols.paramStr: (contents, channels?, ratio?, fancyUpscaling?, tryRecoverTruncated?, acceptableFraction?, dctMethod?)

parameters.name: contents
parameters.documentation: The JPEG-encoded image in an Uint8Array.

parameters.name: channels
parameters.documentation:
An optional int. Defaults to 0. Accepted values are
0: use the number of channels in the PNG-encoded image.
1: output a grayscale image.
3: output an RGB image.

parameters.name: ratio
parameters.documentation:
An optional int. Defaults to 1. Downscaling ratio. It is used
when image is type Jpeg.

parameters.name: fancyUpscaling
parameters.documentation:
An optional bool. Defaults to True. If true use a
slower but nicer upscaling of the chroma planes. It is used when image is
type Jpeg.

parameters.name: tryRecoverTruncated
parameters.documentation:
An optional bool. Defaults to False. If true try
to recover an image from truncated input. It is used when image is type
Jpeg.

parameters.name: acceptableFraction
parameters.documentation:
An optional float. Defaults to 1. The minimum
required fraction of lines before a truncated input is accepted. It is
used when image is type Jpeg.

parameters.name: dctMethod
parameters.documentation:
An optional string. Defaults to "". string specifying a hint
about the algorithm used for decompression. Defaults to "" which maps to
a system-specific default. Currently valid values are ["INTEGER_FAST",
"INTEGER_ACCURATE"]. The hint may be ignored (e.g., the internal jpeg
library changes to a version that does not have that specific option.) It
is used when image is type Jpeg.

symbols.documentation: Decode a JPEG-encoded image to a 3D Tensor of dtype `int32`.

parameters.name: contents
parameters.documentation: The BMP-encoded image in an Uint8Array.

parameters.name: channels
parameters.documentation:
An optional int. Defaults to 0. Accepted values are
0: use the number of channels in the PNG-encoded image.
1: output a grayscale image.
3: output an RGB image.
4: output an RGBA image.

parameters.name: dtype
parameters.documentation:
The data type of the result. Only `int32` is supported at this
time.

symbols.documentation: Decode a PNG-encoded image to a 3D Tensor of dtype `int32`.

symbols.paramStr: (image, format?, quality?, progressive?, optimizeSize?, chromaDownsampling?, densityUnit?, xDensity?, yDensity?, xmpMetadata?)

parameters.name: image
parameters.documentation: A 3-D uint8 Tensor of shape [height, width, channels].

parameters.name: format
parameters.documentation:
An optional string from: "", "grayscale", "rgb".
Defaults to "". Per pixel image format.
- '': Use a default format based on the number of channels in the image.
- grayscale: Output a grayscale JPEG image. The channels dimension of
image must be 1.
- rgb: Output an RGB JPEG image. The channels dimension of image must
be 3.

parameters.name: quality
parameters.documentation:
An optional int. Defaults to 95. Quality of the compression
from 0 to 100 (higher is better and slower).

parameters.name: progressive
parameters.documentation:
An optional bool. Defaults to False. If True, create a
JPEG that loads progressively (coarse to fine).

parameters.name: optimizeSize
parameters.documentation:
An optional bool. Defaults to False. If True, spend
CPU/RAM to reduce size with no quality change.

parameters.name: chromaDownsampling
parameters.documentation:
An optional bool. Defaults to True.
See http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chroma_subsampling.

parameters.name: densityUnit
parameters.documentation:
An optional string from: "in", "cm". Defaults to "in".
Unit used to specify x_density and y_density: pixels per inch ('in') or
centimeter ('cm').

parameters.name: xDensity
parameters.documentation:
An optional int. Defaults to 300. Horizontal pixels per
density unit.

parameters.name: yDensity
parameters.documentation:
An optional int. Defaults to 300. Vertical pixels per
density unit.

parameters.name: xmpMetadata
parameters.documentation:
An optional string. Defaults to "". If not empty, embed
this XMP metadata in the image header.

symbols.documentation: Encodes an image tensor to JPEG.

parameters.name: image
parameters.documentation: A 3-D uint8 Tensor of shape [height, width, channels].

parameters.name: compression
parameters.documentation: An optional int. Defaults to -1. Compression level.

symbols.documentation: Encodes an image tensor to PNG.

A `tf.TFSavedModel` is a signature loaded from a SavedModel
metagraph, and allows inference exeuction.

methods.documentation:
Delete the SavedModel from nodeBackend and delete corresponding session in
the C++ backend if the session is only used by this TFSavedModel.

parameters.name: config
parameters.documentation: Prediction configuration for specifying the batch size.

methods.documentation: Execute the inference for the input tensors.

parameters.name: outputs
parameters.documentation:
string|string[]. List of output node names to retrieve
activation from.

methods.documentation:
Execute the inference for the input tensors and return activation
values for specified output node names without batching.

parameters.name: path
parameters.documentation: Path to SavedModel folder.

symbols.documentation:
Inspect the MetaGraphs of the SavedModel from the provided path. This
function will return an array of `MetaGraphInfo` objects.

parameters.name: path
parameters.documentation: The path to the SavedModel.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.documentation:
The tags of the MetaGraph to load. The available tags of a
SavedModel can be retrieved through tf.node.getMetaGraphsFromSavedModel()
API. Defaults to ['serve'].

parameters.name: signature
parameters.documentation:
The name of the SignatureDef to load. The available
SignatureDefs of a SavedModel can be retrieved through
tf.node.getMetaGraphsFromSavedModel() API. Defaults to 'serving_default'.

symbols.documentation:
Load a TensorFlow SavedModel from disk. TensorFlow SavedModel is different
from TensorFlow.js model format. A SavedModel is a directory containing
serialized signatures and the states needed to run them. The directory has a
saved_model.pb (or saved_model.pbtxt) file storing the actual TensorFlow
program, or model, and a set of named signatures, each identifying a
function. The directory also has a variables directory contains a standard
training checkpoint. The directory may also has a assets directory contains
files used by the TensorFlow graph, for example text files used to initialize
vocabulary tables. For more information, see this guide:
https://www.tensorflow.org/guide/saved_model.
